channel.title: What's wrong with this?
channel.description:
[code=html]

This page is here to confirm your order. Select the product you selected before to confirm which product you'd like from us.

Username:
[/code] When I click the "Buy now" button, nothing will happen. But then if I used an old page I made, it'd work. The old page: [code=html]

This page is here to confirm your order. Select the product you selected before to confirm which product you'd like from us.

Username:
[/code]

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

IIRC, you can’t echo any output when headers have already been sent unless you explicitly set output buffering.

Try something like…

ob_start(); // start output buffer
echo '1';
$username = trim($_POST['username']);
$prod = trim($_POST['prod']);
header("Location: paypal.php?username=". $username ."&prod=". $prod);
ob_end_flush(); // flush output contents

See here: Output Buffering

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:545337”]I don’t really know php well. But You should look into connecting your shop to a mysql database (this is what I did). You can load all the product data from there and it would make it a breeze to add/remove products, since you could just add a couple buttons for the owner on the current page.
Mine is done alongside my SMF database, so it checks if the member has admin rights, if so, show the options.

Also, what are you testing this on?
http://writecodeonline.com/php/
The code worked seemingly fine over on that site.[/quote]
Wow, doesn’t work on my website but works there…

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t really know php well. But You should look into connecting your shop to a mysql database (this is what I did). You can load all the product data from there and it would make it a breeze to add/remove products, since you could just add a couple buttons for the owner on the current page.
Mine is done alongside my SMF database, so it checks if the member has admin rights, if so, show the options.

Also, what are you testing this on?
http://writecodeonline.com/php/
The code worked seemingly fine over on that site.

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:2, topic:545337”]it’s php[/quote]YOU’RE SO DAMN HELPFUL

I don’t think you’re allowed to echo anything to the page before the header is called.

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

<?php

	if(isset($_POST['submit1'])) {
		$errors = array();
		
		echo '1';
		$username = trim($_POST['username']);
		$prod = trim($_POST['prod']);
		header("Location: paypal.php?username=". $username ."&prod=". $prod);
		exit;
	}
		
?>

            <div class="col-lg-12">
                <p>This page is here to confirm your order. Select the product you selected before to confirm which product you'd like from us.</p>
				<form action="<?php echo basename($_SERVER['PHP_SELF']); ?>" method="POST">
				<table>
					<tr>
					<td>Username:</td>
					<td><input type="text" name="username" value="" /></td>
				</tr>
				<select name="prod">
					<option value="1">Product 1</option>
					<option value="2">Product 2</option>
				</select>
				<tr>
					<td colspan="2"><input type="submit" name="submit1" value="Buy now" /></td>
				</tr>
				</table>
	</form>
            </div>
        </div>
        </div>

When I click the “Buy now” button, nothing will happen. But then if I used an old page I made, it’d work.

The old page:

<?php

	if(isset($_POST['submit1'])) {
		$errors = array();
		
		$username = trim($_POST['username']);
		$prod = trim($_POST['prod']);
		header("Location: paypal.php?username=". $username ."&prod=". $prod);
		exit;
	}
		
?>

                <p>This page is here to confirm your order. Select the product you selected before to confirm which product you'd like from us.</p>
				<form action="<?php echo basename($_SERVER['PHP_SELF']); ?>" method="POST">
				<table>
					<tr>
					<td>Username:</td>
					<td><input type="text" name="username" value="" /></td>
				</tr>
				<select name="prod">
					<option value="1">Product 1</option>
					<option value="2">Product 2</option>
				</select>
				<tr>
					<td colspan="2"><input type="submit" name="submit1" value="Buy now" /></td>
				</tr>
				</table>
	</form>
            </div>
        </div>

Read full topic
